title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 §§ 272-3.1 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 §§ 272-3.1 - Definitions

State Regulations

As used in relation to fresh fruits and vegetables being
offered for sale at retail and as used in this Part: (a) Sale at retail
means a
transaction wherein a person sells or offers for sale fresh fruits or
vegetables to consumers at the place of business of such person. Places of
business carrying on the aforesaid transaction include supermarkets, grocery
stores and other retail foodstores. (b) Small quantities of fresh fruits
and vegetables
means amounts by count, weight or volume of whole
fruits or vegetables smaller than the amounts of such fruits or vegetables
being offered for sale at retail in prepackaged form. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1
§§
272-3.1

Repealed

New

York State Register June 22, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 25, eff. 6/22/2016

New

York State Register December 21, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 51, eff. 12/21/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
